member_organisations: You can find a list of our members in our annual Report via http://geschaeftsbericht.iwkoeln.de/2016/.
fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Trade, Competition, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: European macro economics, finance and financial Regulation, competition policy, innovation policy, energy and climate policy, migration policy, trade policy, internal market policy. Please see our research portfolio on our Website.
organisation_name: Institut der deutschen Wirtschaft Köln e.V. (IW)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
source: European Social Fund for Germany, Berlin; European Commission, Brussels
goals__remit:
The Institut der deutschen Wirtschaft Köln e.V. is a private German economic research institute. It seeks to support common views and objectives of the German business community through fact-based, policy-relevant, up-to-date and empirically and methodically sound research. The Institut is promoted by BDI and BDA, the German Business Representations. Its members are German industrial associations, which are directly or indirectly represented by BDI and BDA. 
The Institut stands up for a liberal economic system and acts as an advocate of the Social Market Economy.  Its efforts are dedicated to the general public and politicians as well as to businesses and academia. It contributes to the policy debate through a combined approach of research, advice and communication and enhances insights of economic and social issues.
